zh-cn: 亚历山大·恩斯特·阿尔弗雷德·赫尔曼·冯·法肯豪森
en: Alexander Ernst Alfred Hermann Freiherr von Falkenhausen

birth_place.zh-cn: 德意志帝国西里西亚省布卢门塔尔

death_place.zh-cn: 德意志联邦共和国莱茵兰-普法尔茨拿骚

description.zh-cn: 德国陆军将领，最高军阶为步兵上将。曾任德国驻中华民国军事顾问团团长，以及二战期间德国占领下比利时和法国北部的军政府司令官。
description.en: A German general who served as the head of the German military mission to China and as the military governor of Belgium and Northern France during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 德国军事家，曾任德国军事顾问团领导人。
description.en: German military officer who previously led the German military mission in China.

description.zh-cn: 在1928年至1938年间，由德国派遣至中华民国，协助国民革命军进行军事改革与训练的顾问团体。
description.en: A group of German military advisors sent to the Republic of China between 1928 and 1938 to assist in the reform and training of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 指20世纪30年代至40年代，中国抵抗大日本帝国侵略的全面战争。
description.en: The full-scale war fought between China and the Empire of Japan from the 1930s to the 1940s.

description.zh-cn: 指阿道夫·希特勒和纳粹党统治下的德国。
description.en: Germany under the rule of Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party.

description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间的日本国号。
description.en: The official name of the state of Japan from 1868 to 1947.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任中华民国总统、国民政府主席。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the leader of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 比利时和法国北部军事行政区

zh-cn: 比利时和法国北部军事行政区
en: Military Administration in Belgium and Northern France

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间，纳粹德国在占领的比利时和法国北部地区设立的临时军事占领机构。
description.en: An interim occupation authority established by Nazi Germany during World War II in occupied Belgium and northern France.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国的精锐准军事组织。
description.en: A major paramilitary organization under Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party in Nazi Germany.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国的国家秘密警察。
description.en: The official secret police of Nazi Germany.

description.zh-cn: 一个族教群体，起源于中东的以色列人或希伯来人。
description.en: An ethnoreligious group originating from the Israelites or Hebrews of the ancient Near East.

description.zh-cn: 华裔比利时化学家，在二战期间从纳粹枪口下拯救了近百名比利时人，并为法肯豪森辩护作证。
description.en: A Chinese-Belgian chemist who rescued nearly 100 Belgians from the Nazis during World War II and later testified in defense of Falkenhausen.

description.zh-cn: 二战期间在比利时抵抗德国占领的抵抗运动组织的总称。
description.en: A collective term for resistance movements that fought against the German occupation of Belgium during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 奥地利裔德国政治人物，纳粹党领袖，纳粹德国元首。
description.en: An Austrian-born German politician who was the dictator of Germany and the leader of the Nazi Party.

description.zh-cn: 德国政治家，德国抵抗运动的重要成员。
description.en: A German politician and a key figure in the German resistance to Nazism.

description.zh-cn: 德国陆军元帅，德国抵抗运动成员，7月20日密谋案的主要人物之一。
description.en: A German field marshal and a member of the German Resistance, and a key figure in the 20 July plot.

description.zh-cn: 1944年7月20日，德国抵抗运动成员在“狼穴”总部刺杀阿道夫·希特勒并夺取政权的未遂事件。
description.en: A failed attempt by members of the German Resistance to assassinate Adolf Hitler and seize control of the government at the Wolf's Lair headquarters on 20 July 1944.

description.zh-cn: 1949年5月23日在美、英、法三国占领区成立的国家。
description.en: A country established on 23 May 1949 in the zones occupied by the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.

description.zh-cn: 于1912年在中国大陆建立的共和制国家。
description.en: A republic established in mainland China in 1912.

description.zh-cn: 促进德国与中国文化交流的组织。
description.en: An organization dedicated to promoting cultural exchange between Germany and China.

nodes.id: 总顾问法肯豪森关于应付时局对策之建议

zh-cn: 总顾问法肯豪森关于应付时局对策之建议

description.zh-cn: 由法肯豪森于1935年呈送给蒋介石的战略建议书，提出了持久抗战以及将四川作为最后防地的设想。
description.en: A strategic proposal submitted by Falkenhausen to Chiang Kai-shek in 1935, which put forward the idea of a protracted war of resistance and designated Sichuan as the final defensive base.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末于中国发生的一场反对外国帝国主义的武装运动。
description.en: An anti-imperialist, anti-foreign, and anti-Christian uprising that took place in China at the end of the 19th century.

description.zh-cn: 普鲁士王国及后来的德意志帝国的总参谋部军事学院。
description.en: The military staff college of the Prussian Army and later the German Imperial Army.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森于1930年受邀到中国担任军事顾问，并于1935年3月接替汉斯·冯·塞克特成为顾问团的最后一任领导人。
description.en: Falkenhausen was invited to China in 1930 as a military advisor and succeeded Hans von Seeckt in March 1935 as the last head of the advisory group.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森受邀担任蒋中正的军事顾问。
description.en: Falkenhausen was invited to serve as Chiang Kai-shek's military advisor.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森曾跟随东亚远征军参加了镇压义和团的军事行动。
description.en: Falkenhausen participated in the military operations to suppress the Boxer Rebellion as part of the East Asian Expeditionary Force.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森于1904年至1907年在战争学院进修。
description.en: Falkenhausen studied at the War College from 1904 to 1907.

relationships.source: 总顾问法肯豪森关于应付时局对策之建议

description.zh-cn: 国民政府根据法肯豪森的建议进行了整体的军备建设及防卫部署，为持久抗战做准备。
description.en: Based on Falkenhausen's suggestions, the Nationalist Government carried out overall armament construction and defense deployment in preparation for a protracted war of resistance.

description.zh-cn: 1937年，德国正式与日本结盟，并承认日本在中国的傀儡政权满洲国。
description.en: In 1937, Germany formally allied with Japan and recognized Manchukuo, Japan's puppet state in China.

description.zh-cn: 为向日本表示善意，德国政府强迫法肯豪森辞去中华民国军事顾问职务并召其回国。
description.en: As a gesture of goodwill towards Japan, the German government forced Falkenhausen to resign from his position as a military advisor to the Republic of China and recalled him to Germany.

relationships.target: 比利时和法国北部军事行政区

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森担任二战时德国占领下的比利时和法国北部的军政府司令官。
description.en: Falkenhausen served as the commander of the military government in German-occupied Belgium and northern France during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 在担任比利时占领区军政府司令官期间，法肯豪森与党卫军暗中抗衡。
description.en: During his tenure as military governor of occupied Belgium, Falkenhausen secretly contended with the SS.

description.zh-cn: 在担任比利时占领区军政府司令官期间，法肯豪森与盖世太保暗中抗衡。
description.en: During his tenure as military governor of occupied Belgium, Falkenhausen secretly contended with the Gestapo.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森签署了17道反犹太人的命令，这些命令是1942年从比利时驱逐犹太人的前奏。
description.en: Falkenhausen signed 17 anti-Jewish orders, which were a prelude to the deportation of Jews from Belgium in 1942.

description.zh-cn: 钱秀玲曾两次向法肯豪森求情，使其特赦了约100名被判死刑的比利时反抗组织成员。战后，她也出面为法肯豪森辩护作证。
description.en: Qian Xiuling twice pleaded with Falkenhausen, leading him to pardon about 100 condemned members of the Belgian resistance. After the war, she also testified in his defense.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森是卡尔·格德勒的亲密朋友。
description.en: Falkenhausen was a close friend of Carl Goerdeler.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森是埃尔温·冯·维茨莱本的亲密朋友。
description.en: Falkenhausen was a close friend of Erwin von Witzleben.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森逐渐开始憎恶希特勒与纳粹政权。
description.en: Falkenhausen grew to despise Hitler and the Nazi regime.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森支持其朋友维茨莱本的一个军事政变计划，并因此卷入7月20日密谋案。
description.en: Falkenhausen supported a military coup plan by his friend Witzleben and thus became involved in the 20 July plot.

description.zh-cn: 在7月20日密谋案失败后，法肯豪森被解除职务和逮捕，并辗转于多个集中营。
description.en: After the failure of the 20 July plot, Falkenhausen was dismissed from his post, arrested, and transferred between several concentration camps.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森在被比利时法庭判处12年监禁的三周后，被西德总理特赦。
description.en: Three weeks after being sentenced to 12 years in prison by a Belgian court, Falkenhausen was pardoned by the West German Chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 1950年法肯豪森72岁生日时，收到蒋中正的12,000元美金作为贺礼，并称他为“中国的友人”。
description.en: On Falkenhausen's 72nd birthday in 1950, he received $12,000 from Chiang Kai-shek as a gift, who called him a 'friend of China'.

description.zh-cn: 法肯豪森在晚年曾担任德中文化协会会长。
description.en: In his later years, Falkenhausen served as the president of the German-Chinese Cultural Association.

description.zh-cn: 1958年11月28日，中华民国政府授予法肯豪森勋章。
description.en: On November 28, 1958, the government of the Republic of China awarded a medal to Falkenhausen.
